FuncDef: The display nat server-map command displays server-map table information on internal servers.
CLIs: display nat server-map [ static | dynamic | port-forwarding ] [ slot <slot-id> { engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> } | ip <ip-address> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | port <port-number> ] *
display nat server-map [ static | dynamic ] [ slot <slot-id> | ip <ip-address> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | port <port-number> ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Displays server-map table information on internal servers.
-

Displays server-map table information automatically generated by an ALG.
-

Displays server-map table information with the port-forwarding attribute.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value can be 0 to 3.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Displays server-map entry information with a specified IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays server-map table information with a specified VPN instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays server-map table information with a port number.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535.

Examples: This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
<HUAWEI> display nat server-map static slot 1 engine 0 ip 192.168.11.1
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
<HUAWEI> display nat server-map dynamic slot 1 engine 0
This operation will take a few minutes. Press 'Ctrl+C' to break ...
ExtraInfo: To view server-map table information on internal servers, run the display nat server-map command. The command displays information based on a specified IP address, port number, and protocol type.
